bibl.title: Letter from L.C. Bell to Henry Rose Carter, February 16, 1916

div1.p: Bell expresses his appreciation for Carter's report on a local swamp and mentions a potential mosquito survey for the following summer.

div1.head: Letter from L.C. Bell to Henry Rose Carter, February 16, 1916
div1.opener:
SPECIALTIES
WIDE CLEAR
CYPRESS
CYPRESS MOULDINGS
AND FINISH
THE COLLETON CYPRESS COMPANY
MANUFACTURERS OF
CYPRESS AND PINE LUMBER
LATH AND SHINGLES
GENERAL OFFICES: COLUMBUS, OHIO
Columbus, Ohio, February 16th, 1916.
MILLS, COLLETON, S. C.
EASTERN SALES OFFICE,
338 LAND TITLE BLDG.
PHILADELPHIA, PA.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
United States Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
I beg to acknowledge receipt of your letter of the
14th enclosing your report of examination of the swamp, also
memorandum for gauge stakes and cross-section levels, and also
your bill. Your report is very interesting indeed, and will
no doubt afford us lawyers the information as to the particular
points around which we should accumulate evidence and authority
for the defense of the cases.

I have communicated with Messrs. Padgett & Moorer and
our Superintendent at Colleton to be guided by your suggestion
in reference to the gauge stakes, etc.

In reference to your bill, I beg to enclose you here-
with check of The Colleton Cypress Company for the sum of $345.35
in payment thereof and return the bill and will thank you to re-
ceipt the same and return to me for our files.

I am very much pleased to note that you and Mr. LePrince
will, if you can, make the mosquito survey for us next summer.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, L. C. Bell
General Counsel. LCB/WFS
